docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: I ONCE TUTORED JUNIOR-high geometry, and one of my most difficult pupils would sit at the kitchen table - wild hair flying, bubble gum popping - as she insisted again and again that she didn't understand.
docs.snippet: LEAD: I ONCE TUTORED JUNIOR-high geometry, and one of my most difficult pupils would sit at the kitchen table - wild hair flying, bubble gum popping - as she insisted again and again that she didn't understand.

byline.original: BY ROBIN MARANTZ HENIG; Robin Marantz Henig is the author of three books on health and is a regular contributor to this column
